title: Universal Electricity Access — Accelerated Last Mile Connectivity Targets
description: Government directive requiring KPLC to accelerate Phase IV of the Last Mile Connectivity Project and achieve 200,000 new connections in rural and peri-urban areas by 30 June 2025. KPLC to allocate minimum 25% of capital budget to LMCP.
notes: Linked to President's 100% electrification agenda. Progress reports required monthly to PS Energy.

title: Kenya Airways Cost Reduction — 15% Non-Fuel Operational Cost Target
description: Government directive requiring Kenya Airways to achieve a 15% reduction in non-fuel operational costs compared to FY2023 baseline by 31 December 2024 as part of the ongoing restructuring programme. Implementation plan to be submitted to State Department for Transport within 30 days.
notes: Part of government conditions for continued support of KQ restructuring programme. Non-compliance may trigger accelerated debt repayment demands.

title: SOE ESG Reporting — Mandatory Standardised Framework
description: All Tier 1 State Corporations are required to adopt and report using the standardised ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) reporting framework developed by the State Department for Public Service and Performance Management. First ESG reports under the new framework due 31 March 2025.
issuingAuthority: State Department for Public Service and Performance Management
notes: Framework aligned with GRI Standards and Kenya's NDC commitments under Paris Agreement. Capacity building workshops scheduled for November 2024.

title: Port Tariff Increase — Mombasa Port FY2024
description: Approval of Kenya Ports Authority's request to increase port tariffs by 8% effective 1 July 2024, subject to KPA implementing the Port Community System Phase 2 within 12 months and achieving average vessel turnaround time of less than 4 days.
notes: Tariff increase effective from FY2024/25. PCS Phase 2 implementation target December 2024.

title: Kenya Airways Government Equity Injection and Restructuring Framework
description: Government directive authorising the equity injection of KES 15,000,000,000 into Kenya Airways through conversion of existing government-guaranteed debt to equity and approval of the Kenya Airways Restructuring Plan 2023-2026.
notes: Equity injection completed. Restructuring plan implementation ongoing — target return to profitability by 2026.

title: Mwongozo Code of Governance — Enhanced Compliance
description: All state corporations to conduct annual board effectiveness self-assessments using the updated Mwongozo tool developed by the Centre for Corporate Governance (CCG) and submit reports to respective Principal Secretaries by 28 February each year.
notes: KPLC and KPA submitted 2023 assessments on time. KQ submission was 15 days late — flagged by SCAC.

title: Green Energy Transition — Renewable Energy Integration Targets
description: KPLC directed to develop and implement a Green Energy Transition Plan ensuring Kenya achieves 100% renewable electricity generation by 2030, in line with the National Energy Policy 2018 and NDC commitments. Plan to be submitted to PS Energy by 30 June 2024.
notes: KPLC submitted Green Energy Transition Plan in July 2024 — approved by board in July 2024. Targets 100% renewable supply by 2035 (revised from 2030 due to grid stability considerations).

title: Blue Economy Strategy — Port Operations Alignment
description: KPA required to align port development and operations with Kenya's Blue Economy Strategy, including development of a fisheries processing zone at Mombasa, marine environmental monitoring programme, and plastic waste reduction targets in port operations.
issuingAuthority: State Department for Maritime and Shipping
notes: Fisheries processing zone feasibility study underway. Environmental monitoring buoys deployed in Kilindini Channel.

title: Kenya Aviation Safety Programme — KCAA Compliance Enhancement
description: Kenya Airways directed to implement KCAA-recommended safety management system enhancements within 90 days, including enhanced fatigue risk management for flight crew, updated emergency procedures, and compliance with all outstanding KCAA audit findings.
notes: All 8 KCAA audit findings closed by 10 April 2024. KCAA issued closure certificate on 20 April 2024.

title: Public Procurement — Local Content and SME Participation
description: All state corporations to ensure minimum 40% of procurement contracts by value are awarded to local Kenyan firms, including at least 20% to youth-owned, women-owned, and PWD enterprises, in compliance with the AGPO framework. Quarterly AGPO reports to be submitted to the National Treasury.
notes: KPLC Q1 FY2025 report showed 38% local content — slightly below target. KPA at 44%. KQ at 35% — implementing improvement plan.

title: Pre-paid Electricity Metering — Mandatory Transition
description: KPLC directed to migrate all post-paid customers to pre-paid smart meters by 31 December 2024. Customers in default of more than 3 months to be prioritised for migration. EPRA to be notified of migration progress quarterly.
notes: As of October 2024, 4.8 million customers (82%) migrated to smart pre-paid meters. Remaining 1.1 million customers to be completed by December 2024.

title: ISPS Code — Maritime Security Upgrade
description: KPA required to upgrade security infrastructure at Kilindini Harbour and Lamu Port to comply with International Ship and Port Facility Security (ISPS) Code amendments effective 1 January 2023, including installation of automated vessel tracking, enhanced access control, and training of 500 security personnel.
issuingAuthority: State Department for Maritime and Shipping
notes: All ISPS Code upgrades completed by December 2022. IMO Port State Control inspection passed with commendation in February 2023.

title: Digital Financial Services — Transition to e-Payments
description: All state corporations to ensure minimum 90% of financial transactions (payments and collections) are conducted through digital channels by 31 December 2023. Specific targets include 100% payroll through bank transfers, 80% supplier payments via RTGS/EFT, and all customer payments digital.
notes: All three SOEs achieved 100% payroll digital and 95%+ supplier payments digital by October 2023. KPLC introduced M-PESA bill payments reaching 3.2 million customers.

title: Kenya Airways Fleet Rationalisation — Disposal of Non-Core Assets
description: Kenya Airways directed to dispose of a minimum 3 aircraft (including Boeing 777-300ER identified in board resolution KQB/140/001) by 31 March 2024 and use proceeds to reduce outstanding bank debt. Any disposal below estimated fair value to receive prior approval from National Treasury.
notes: Two Boeing 777-300ER aircraft disposed by April 2024. Proceeds of USD 68m applied to KCB Bank debt reduction. Third aircraft disposal deferred to Q3 2024.

title: Electricity System Reliability — SAIDI/SAIFI Minimum Standards
description: KPLC required to meet minimum reliability standards: SAIDI not exceeding 35 hours per customer per year and SAIFI not exceeding 15 interruptions per customer per year by 30 June 2025. Failure to meet standards will result in EPRA-imposed penalty clawbacks from allowed revenue.
notes: FY2024 SAIDI reached 38 hours — improvement from 45 hours in FY2022 but short of 35-hour target. On track for FY2025 target.

title: Gender Mainstreaming — 30% Women in Leadership
description: All state corporations to achieve minimum 30% female representation at board level and 30% at senior management level by 31 December 2024, in compliance with the Constitution of Kenya 2010 two-thirds gender rule.
notes: KPLC: 33% female board, 28% female senior management. KPA: 35% female board, 32% female senior management. KQ: 30% female board, 24% female senior management — implementing action plan.

title: Mombasa Port Concession — Performance Improvement
description: KPA directed to impose performance improvement requirements on the container terminal concessionaire, requiring reduction of dwell time to a maximum of 4 days by 31 December 2022 and average vessel turnaround of 72 hours by 31 December 2023.
notes: Average dwell time reduced to 3.8 days (Dec 2022) and vessel turnaround to 3.2 days (Dec 2023). Both targets exceeded.

title: Kenya Airways — CORSIA Phase 1 Compliance
description: Kenya Airways required to comply with ICAO's Carbon Offsetting and Reduction Scheme for International Aviation (CORSIA) Phase 1 requirements commencing January 2024, including monitoring, reporting, and verification (MRV) of CO2 emissions from all international routes, and acquisition of CORSIA eligible offset units.
notes: MRV system installed. FY2024 emissions data being collected. First offset obligation estimated at 48,000 tonnes CO2 for 2024.

title: Performance Contracting — Minimum Score Requirements
description: All Tier 1 State Corporations must achieve a minimum performance contract score of 70% (Satisfactory) to qualify for discretionary budget support and dividend waivers. Corporations scoring below 70% will be subject to a Government Performance Improvement Plan.
notes: FY2023 scores: KPLC 82%, KPA 88%, KQ 65% (below threshold — improvement plan issued). FY2024 first quarter results submitted.

title: Kenya Airways Regional Connectivity — New Route Requirements
description: Kenya Airways directed to maintain minimum scheduled services on Nairobi–Kisumu, Nairobi–Eldoret, Nairobi–Malindi, and Nairobi–Lamu routes as a public service obligation, regardless of route profitability. Routes to be operated at minimum 4 times weekly per route.
notes: All four routes maintained as PSO. KQ receives public service obligation subsidy of KES 1.2bn annually from State Department for Transport.

title: Nuclear Energy Programme — KPLC Grid Readiness Assessment
description: KPLC directed to commission a grid readiness assessment for integration of nuclear power by December 2024, in support of the Nuclear Power Programme being developed by the Ministry of Energy and Kenya Nuclear Electricity Board (KNEB). Assessment to cover grid stability, grid code updates, and investment requirements.
notes: Grid readiness study contracted to AECOM Africa. Preliminary findings expected October 2024.

title: Lamu Port — LAPSSET Corridor First Phase Commercial Operations
description: KPA directed to ensure commercial readiness of Lamu Port Berths 1-3 for LAPSSET corridor operations by 1 August 2023, including completion of customs and immigration facilities, shore power, berthing aids, and port health facilities.
notes: Lamu Port Berth 3 commercial operations commenced 1 August 2023 as directed. Berths 1-2 were already operational.

title: Cybersecurity — Minimum Standards for State Corporations
description: All state corporations to implement the Kenya National Cybersecurity Framework minimum standards, including ISO 27001 certification for all core IT systems, CISO appointment, annual penetration testing, and incident response plans, by 31 December 2025.
notes: KPLC and KPA conducting gap assessments. KQ claims partial compliance through IOSA requirements. Budget allocations confirmed in FY2025 capex plans.

title: SOE Dividend Policy — Minimum Dividend Requirements
description: All profitable Tier 1 State Corporations required to remit minimum dividend of 50% of audited net profit to the National Treasury, or such higher amount as may be directed by the Cabinet Secretary for National Treasury. Dividend declarations to occur no later than 3 months after financial year-end.
notes: KPA has consistently paid minimum 50% of net profit. KPLC paid 25% in FY2023 — below policy minimum. KPLC to demonstrate plan to increase dividend payout ratio by FY2025.

title: Power Purchase Agreement Rationalisation
description: KPLC directed to renegotiate all Power Purchase Agreements with Independent Power Producers (IPPs) that have capacity charge obligations in excess of EPRA benchmarks. Objective is to reduce aggregate power purchase costs by KES 5bn annually. Renegotiation to be completed by 31 December 2022.
notes: PPA renegotiation completed with 7 IPPs by September 2022. Estimated annual savings of KES 4.2bn (84% of target) achieved. Remaining savings to be realised as legacy PPAs expire.
